poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: We share a house, a home, a base. I do This walking bass routine to work. The breaks are partly planned and Partly not the kind of thing Goes through my mind as - brakes! The car's a curling stone. Brace. Beside the borehole Someone baits a hook and pats the hipflask Where winter bakes the river hard And bastes the ice with snow.
